title: The Farwest Guide to Maui
name: The Farwest Guide to Maui
description:
A Map by Nihaofarwest

Where to eat mostly :)  
www.thefarwest.net

properties.name: Black Rock
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest  The head of Ka\'anapali beach. Not a bad place to snorkel. At sunset some guy jumps off the rock after lighting torches. Ka\'anapali beach is a great place to catch a luau or go pool hopping. It\'s full of fancy hotels.

properties.name: Hosmer's Grove
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest Great place to camp if you\'d like to drive up to the crater to catch the sunrise.

properties.name: Iao Valley
properties.description: Posted by NihaofarwestDon\'t do what the bus loads of tourists do. Explore this park, go off the beaten path, go swimming, fall in the taro pond. I think you can even hike to Lahaina side if you\'re adventurous, but I\'ve only been half way.

properties.name: Kahalui Airport (OGG)
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwestkahalui airport (OGG)Where you land.

properties.name: Komoda's Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest Komoda\'s BakerThe best donuts in the world. Kicks Krispy Kreme\'s butt. Good pies too.

properties.name: Little Beach
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest  "A place to hang out"... no... seriously... anyways head to the right and follow the trail of people climbing over the rock if you too would like to hang out (please remember the sunscreen). Big Beach is nice too, but watch out for the shorebreak (you catch wave, wave crush you into beach, not fun). Do not leave valuables in the car.

properties.name: Ma'alaea Harbor
properties.description: Posted by NihaofarwestBoats for Molokini and whale watching leave from here. Pride of Maui is a good boat for the Molokini trip.

properties.name: Mama's fish house
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest Mama\'s Fish HouseYummy food, fresh seafood. A bit pricier.

properties.name: Mana Foods
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest Health food, local food, fresh seafood at Mana Food @ 49 Baldwin Ave.

properties.name: Mile Marker 13
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest

properties.name: Mixed Plate Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest kahalui airport (OGG)Yummy food, local style. Kalua pig, lomi lomi salmon, lau lau, etc.

properties.name: Paia Fish Market
properties.description: Posted by NihaofarwestGet your fish here!

properties.name: Polli's Mexican Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest "Come in and eat or we\'ll both starve!" Really good ribs, excellent salsa, and tasty mexican food (anything that sizzles!).

properties.name: Pukalani Superette
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest Small but great super market, mostly due to the hot deli foods. Chili Chicken is a must. Lomi lomi salmon and Potato/Macaroni Salad complete the deal. Maybe an apple turnover? Mmmmm

properties.name: The Cove
properties.description: Posted by NihaofarwestMy brother teaches surfing here sometimes. Very gentle break, shallow waters, but no beach. Just go down the road the the beginning of Kam I for a nice beach spot.

properties.name: Under the Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest 1 of 4 good places to swim in Iao stream.

properties.name: Waimoku falls
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest  Also known as the "Seven Sacred Pools", but there are many more than seven pools. If it\'s not pouring rain, the hike into the valley is great. Big waterfalls. Camping grounds.

properties.name: the Old Banyan Tree
properties.description: Posted by Nihaofarwest I love this tree. It\'s so huge.
